image.alt: Smiling patients and staff at Harrington Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Thank you for visiting the website of Dr. Chad Harrington of Harrington Orthodontics. Dr. Harrington and his team bring years of experience to the greater St. Joseph, Michigan and South Bend, Indiana areas and strive to provide you with the most technologically advanced orthodontics available.
We provide individualized treatment plans and high‑tech systems (metal and clear braces, clear aligners, Damon technology), plus convenient hours so your care fits your life.

items.title: Personalized Care
items.text: Every patient receives an individualized treatment plan designed to meet their specific goals and deliver long-term, healthy results.

items.title: High-Tech Care
items.text: We use the latest orthodontic technologies for more comfortable treatments that can finish faster than traditional methods.

items.title: Damon Advantage
items.text: The Damon bracket system can move teeth more efficiently with lighter forces, often reducing treatment time, discomfort, and the need for extractions.

items.title: Flexible Payments

image.alt: Orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults

items.text: Flexible financing options and early, mid and evening appointments make treatment accessible for busy families.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Chad Fulton Harrington, DDS, is a board-certified orthodontist who leads Harrington Orthodontics. Born and raised in South Bend, Indiana, he earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery degree from Indiana University School of Dentistry in 2002, graduating with honors and membership in Omicron Kappa Upsilon. He completed his orthodontic specialty program and Master of Science in dentistry at St. Louis University Center for Advanced Dental Education in 2004. Dr. Harrington is a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics and an active member of regional and national dental organizations. He serves on the local craniofacial and cleft lip and palate team and is committed to providing thoughtful, technology-driven care for patients of all ages.
Comprehensive orthodontic care for children, teens and adults, including Damon braces and clear aligners to fit many lifestyles and treatment goals.

testimonials.author: Jannelle C
testimonials.testimonial: “I am sitting in the office waiting for my retainers as I write this review. The whole process of adult braces was much better than I expected. Dr. Harrington and the staff are professional, warm, and efficient. They have this process down! If you want the best, this is the place!”

testimonials.author: Bill Martin
testimonials.testimonial: “Great people. Dr. Harrington and staff are amazing. Thank you for the excellent care.”

testimonials.author: Jackie Stockton
testimonials.testimonial: “We started the process today! 6 teeth with brackets. My son is 10, he was very happy when we left. No pain, no discomfort, everyone was friendly and professional from the moment we walked in the door!!”

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: The team at Harrington Orthodontics is dedicated to serving the needs of each individual patient. With years of experience guiding patients through their orthodontic journeys, we provide warm, family‑focused care at every visit.
We emphasize individualized treatment plans that reflect each patient’s lifestyle and goals, using modern technology to make care more efficient and comfortable.
Our office offers comprehensive options for children, teens, and adults so families can find the right path to a healthy, confident smile.
From clear communication and flexible scheduling to a friendly team that supports you through treatment, our goal is lifelong results and a positive experience at every appointment.

Dr. Chad Fulton Harrington, DDS, MS is a board‑certified orthodontist and a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics. He joined the practice in 2004 and serves on the local craniofacial and cleft lip & palate team, contributing specialized care for complex cases.

Dr. Harrington is committed to comprehensive orthodontic treatment for children, teens, and adults, blending clinical experience with a patient‑centered approach to deliver predictable, comfortable care.

image.alt: Dr. Chad Harrington smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Harrington earned his Bachelor of Science in Biology from the University of Denver and received his Doctor of Dental Surgery from Indiana University School of Dentistry in 2002, graduating with honors.

He completed his orthodontic specialty training at St. Louis University Center for Advanced Dental Education, receiving a Master of Science in dentistry in 2004, and later pursued the American Board of Orthodontics examination process to achieve Diplomate status.

Born and raised in South Bend, Dr. Harrington remains active in the local community and professional organizations. He brings a genuine, personable style to patient care and looks forward to helping families achieve healthy, confident smiles.

image.alt: Header image showing appointment and friendly front desk

paragraphs.text: Every smile starts with a new patient exam. Your initial visit includes a thorough oral exam, any needed X-rays, a review of your clinical diagnosis, and a discussion of a customized treatment plan. If impressions are required, we'll take them during this appointment. Please allow sixty (60) minutes for your first visit.

We offer advanced treatment options, including the Damon System: https://harringtonorthodontics.com/damon-braces/. Dr. Harrington leads our clinical team; learn more about him and the rest of our doctors at https://harringtonorthodontics.com/meet-the-doctors/.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and file claims electronically to make your care convenient.

Flexible payment plans are available. For full details visit our financing page: https://harringtonorthodontics.com/financing-your-treatment/. To schedule a new patient exam online use our booking link: https://edgebooking.ortho2.com/search?catalog=929fd09b-1c4b-4a15-a267-b31a79c6e455&code=kqkgug&cellrequired=true or call 574-233-7444 (tel:+15742337444).

Before your appointment please complete any required patient forms so we can provide safe, personalized care. Access our forms and patient resources at: https://harringtonorthodontics.com/patient-forms/.

We offer virtual consults for children and adults. Note: the exported pages showed embedded JotForm forms missing; if you see a 'form is missing' banner you can sign up with JotForm or contact us for help: https://hipaa.jotform.com/signup/?utm_source={domain}&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=form-deleted. Play icon for the virtual consult overview: https://harringtonorthodontics.com/wp-content/themes/wps_harrington/dist/images/icon-play.svg

og_meta.title: Get Started | Harrington Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Harrington Orthodontics. Book a new patient exam, access forms, and learn what to expect at your first visit.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We are proud to use the Damon Bracket System, a modern approach to braces that often shortens treatment time and improves comfort. Damon’s tieless design uses light continuous forces to move teeth efficiently, and it can reduce the number of adjustment visits while giving reliable results for patients of all ages.

Damon Clear combines tieless bracket technology with discreet, tooth‑colored materials for a less noticeable option. It provides the same efficient tooth movement as the Damon system while prioritizing aesthetics for patients who want a subtler look during treatment.

Self-ligating braces remove the need for elastic ties, reducing friction and often making adjustments more comfortable. This technology can speed progress in the early phases of treatment and is designed to work with lighter forces for efficient tooth movement.

image.alt: Bracket and wire close-up demonstrating self-ligating braces

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a durable, cost-effective choice for many cases, while clear ceramic brackets offer a less visible alternative. Both options are effective at correcting crowded, crooked, or misaligned teeth when paired with a tailored treatment plan.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners are removable, comfortable, and made with 3D imaging for a precise fit. Worn most of the day and changed on a schedule, aligners let you eat and clean normally while straightening teeth, with typical treatment times varying by case complexity.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner in hand

paragraphs.text: Retention keeps your new smile in place. We provide custom retainers and a follow-up plan to protect results long term. Most patients use a combination of full-time and nighttime wear as recommended to maintain alignment.

Phase I, or early interceptive care, helps guide jaw growth and create room for adult teeth. Early expansion and simple appliances can reduce the need for more complex treatment later and may improve breathing and facial development when indicated.

image.alt: Young patient before and after Phase I treatment

paragraphs.text: We use CBCT 3D imaging to evaluate root positions, impacted teeth, airway anatomy, and complex cases. This digital data improves diagnosis and treatment planning while allowing clear communication about proposed care.

image.alt: Digital intraoral scanning and 3D imaging equipment

image.alt: FAQ header image showing smiling patient in a bright orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about treatment costs, scheduling, and office procedures at Harrington Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What is the cost of orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text:
Our initial orthodontic consultations are no charge. So it costs nothing to find out what treatment may be necessary. In fact, there is usually no charge for recall examinations as we watch your child’s teeth develop and mature.
Fee for orthodontic treatment varies depending upon what is needed. The fee for your individualized treatment will be thoroughly discussed and a payment plan established without interest. Many insurance plans now cover orthodontic care. We also accept MasterCard and Visa.

image.alt: Smiling family portrait in orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: An orthodontist is a highly trained specialist who has completed two to three years of training after graduating from dental school. The orthodontic training is a full-time commitment in an accredited university setting.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation with doctor and patient

accordion.header: What age should a child be seen by an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: Dr. Harrington recommends a child be seen by an orthodontist no later than age 7. Early orthodontic screening can lead to simpler, more effective treatment for dental patients or, at the least, greater peace of mind.

image.alt: Young child smiling during an orthodontic checkup

accordion.header: Do I need a referral from my dentist to be seen by Dr. Harrington?

paragraphs.text: No. You or your child can have an orthodontic evaluation at any time you wish. Dr. Harrington will be happy to furnish the dentist with a report of his orthodontic findings and recommendations. A close working relationship usually already exists between our office and that of your dentist.

accordion.header: Could I be too old for orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: An adult who desires orthodontic treatment is never too old. Many adults enjoy the change in their appearance and bite that orthodontics can offer. Our aesthetic, tooth-colored braces make orthodontic treatment almost invisible. Dr. Harrington works closely with your dentist to prepare your teeth for any necessary post-orthodontic dental work. Some adults seek orthodontic care for temporomandibular joint dysfunction (TMJ).

image.alt: Adult patient smiling after orthodontic treatment

accordion.header: Do I still see my dentist for cleanings during orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Dr. Harrington feels it is very important for his patients to continue their routine dental care with the dentist. In fact, we suggest you coordinate dental cleaning appointments with your orthodontic adjustment appointments. We will be happy to help you schedule your appointment so that your brace wires can be removed prior to going to the dentist. Upon replacing the wires we will accomplish your orthodontic adjustment.

image.alt: Patient receiving dental cleaning with orthodontic team support

accordion.header: What type of sterilization procedures does your office use?

paragraphs.text: Sterilization is a high priority in our office. All of the sterilization standards of the American Dental Association are met or exceeded. Heat sterilization of instruments is utilized and disposable items are used whenever possible. New gloves and a mask are used with every patient. We value the trust you place in us regarding sterility and would be happy to discuss our procedures with you.

image.alt: Sterilized instruments and a clean treatment room
